items.title: Superside: Senior UX Designer
items.content:
Senior UX Designer

We are looking for an experienced designer to join our super team of designers as a key member in helping craft the experience of our design service platform. You will be leading the design of new features, conduct research to optimise existing flows as well as contribute to the evolution of our design system and design process. As a part of a distributed company, you will have the freedom to work 100% remotely from your own space, choosing the location and hours that are best for you to have an impact.

This is a full-time position where you will be part of the distributed core team defining and evolving the user experience for both customers as well as design specialists who are part of our platform.

What you’ll do

  • Work with multi-disciplinary teams partnering with engineering, design and product folks finding solutions to design challenges on a wide range of product areas
  • Take ownership of design ideas through the research, ideation, wireframing & prototyping phases to the final well-polished and beautifully crafted experiences
  • Be up to date with and apply best user-centered design practices to create industry leading experiences
  • Make well-informed decisions based on deep understanding of customer needs and strategic business directions
  • Conduct research, user interviews and usability tests as part of your design process to deliver outstanding customer experiences
  • Make use of and contribute to the evolution of our design system, translating abstract concepts to patterns of reusable interactions and components
  • Know when to move fast by making low-fi sketches and when to apply attention to detail by producing pixel-perfect interfaces

About you

  • 5+ years of full-time experience working in-house as a UX / product designer for digital or web-based products
  • You have a strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your design thinking, process, challenges and solutions in web-based products and/or mobile applications
  • You are an expert in understanding customer needs, sketching concepts, tweaking flows or polishing existing designs
  • You are proficient in UX design and prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, InVision, Adobe design tools)
  • You are a great communicator with excellent presentation, interpersonal as well as written and verbal communication skills in English
  • You have strong leadership and teamwork skills and the ability to work together with design leads, engineers and other stakeholders as well as the confidence to communicate your ideas clearly
  • You are primarily based in a time zone +/- 3 hours from UTC

Who is Superside?

We are a people+technology company based nowhere that hires the brightest and most ambitious talent from everywhere. Superside connects enterprise teams who need design to our diverse creative talent. Our unique combination of technology and people allow us to deliver uncompromising design quickly and affordably. We are building world-class experiences for defining, delivering, and collaborating on design projects.

Our team members come from McKinsey, Booking.com, Amazon, Expedia, Pareto Securities, Zalora, as well as leading design agencies and consultancies. Our global team is spread across more than 40 countries.

Superside was part of Y Combinator W2016 and is funded by reputable Silicon Valley investors such as Freestyle Capital, High Alpha, Sam Altman, Slack Fund, Liquid 2 Ventures, Acequia Capital, and others, as well as Norwegian Alliance Venture.

items.content:
Mobile UI/UX Designer

The Company is called Confidently and we provide Confidence mindset coaching to young athletes, eSports players and people in hi-stress jobs or situations.  We have a strong team and funding and are looking to automate hi-performance mindset coaching for the masses.

We are looking for a talented UI/UX designer who gets fun and gamification.  Ideally person will have some background building highly addictive, fun (and in the best possible world, educational) mobile games for teenage, young adult and adult ages - this could be games like Trivia Crack or language learning or similar (think Duolingo).  Need someone with really strong visual sense who will be able to work with us and 'wrestle the bear' of a complex project to help find solutions.   Someone who is mature and able to handle working remotely.

Ideally person can do illustrations and/or animations and has some experience working with characters and sound effects to make games more fun.  If not, they ideally can manage outside contractors and/or clearly communicate what they need to make things happen.

Could be stable work for a pretty long time, but will start with 1 month test, then 2 month extension.

items.title: UI/UX Designer
items.content:
Finding funding for scientific research and completing the necessary applications is time-consuming. Hiring in this industry is difficult largely due to the high degree of specialisation for projects. Founded and shaped by scientists, Lit Lab gives researchers the resources that they need to do great work, helping to fund research and find talent. 


We’re looking for a UX/UI designer to build the interface for our web app. This can built remotely while maintaining a dialogue with the founding team. The chosen candidate will receive £2000 upon completion of the project. Performance will be evaluated and the opportunity to join the company for a proportion of equity may be offered. 


Currently Lit Lab has demoed a prototype to a lab with a research focus on cancer genetics, this validated the idea indicating that we’re trying to solve a compelling problem. We’ve started work on the back end of the site and are looking to have something fully-functional by the end of the year. This is an exciting opportunity to work for a startup looking to advance scientific research. Anybody that wants to do meaningful work and create a truly awesome product should apply.

items.title: Web Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=18}
items.content:
komoot

Web Designer

verified
UTC-1 to UTC+3
**Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times — and with more than 8 million users and 50,000 five-star reviews, komoot is on its way to becoming one of the world’s most popular cycling and hiking apps. Behind the app screen is a passionate fully remote team working from 12 countries — that’s over 50 people with a shared mission to help our users experience real-life adventures, on foot or by bike. If you’d like to help to build the future of outdoor exploration, we’re looking for a talented, enthusiastic Web Designer to join our team.** **Why you will love it** * Your work will enable millions of people to have awesome outdoor experiences * You’ll build and improve a product that we’re pretty sure you’ll end up using for your own outdoor trips * You’ll be developing in fast cycles with continuous testing and building based on direct user feedback * You will become a key player amongst a team of highly motivated and talented people * We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3 * You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides # Responsibilities **What you will do** * Own and drive the web design of core komoot products and take a lead on individual UX work streams * Conceptualize original web design ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex roadblocks, and improve and optimize landing pages * Develop new layouts and interfaces and implement them in CSS and JavaScript * Create mockups, prototypes and user flows to communicate interaction and design ideas * Come up with new features as well as improve the existing ones, test ideas with users and run A/B tests * Work closely with other designers, backend team members and product managers in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users # Requirements **You will be successful in this position if you** * Have 3+ years of experience as a Web designer, UI/UX designer or similar role related to web-based products * Can clearly demonstrate and apply your outstanding skills in developing and implementing layouts, interfaces and user flows * Are highly skilled in HTML, CSS, Figma, and Sketch and have a good knowledge of JavaScript * Have an excellent eye for design and attention to detail: you’re obsessed with designing awesome products that users love * You are up-to-date with the latest web technologies, techniques, and features * Have experience working in a remote team, hand in hand with developers * Have good communication skills and enjoy working with teammates in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users #Location - UTC-1 to UTC+3

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.content:
We are Ultimate Football Fan and we represent some of the biggest names in Football Fan influeners. We create social content, documentaries and are the team behind Blud Bruvvas the show that lets the fans take the field and do their talking on the pitch. 


We are looking for a talented designer to work on ad-hoc basis creating sales decks for our reality shows, bespoke content documentaries and other football related content.     



  •  Telling a visual story, and creating fantastic look and feel for brands, using our content or   football related material 

  • Creating great mood decks

  • Creating decks that incorporate data and heavy detail that is still visually interesting and easy to understand

  • Creating design concepts for business and internal use

  • Contributing to the copy within the deck

  • Experience creating material for pitching concepts and ideas

  • An interest in sports is a bonus but not required


Ideally you will live in or near London so you can come to the office once a week but the role can be entirely remote for the right person. 


We will work on a weekly basis, paying a base fee of £50 - £250 per deck, depending on amount of work;  but with an added commission % of the budget for any deck that wins work.


Please provide a covering letter and a link to your portfolio.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Unnamed Seed Stage Startup | Founding Engineer OR Founding Design/Product Role | Remote and Bay Area | Full Time

We are a new startup in the UX design tool space, with a mission to radically lower the barriers needed to build full-fidelity prototypes and products, and bridging the design-engineering gap. The stage is very early, pre-product, but we have enthusiastic early feedback.

The team of four has three ex-founders. We've previously built startups where we've hired over 100 roles, sold to 20% of F500s, raised over $45mm in aggregate, gotten the businesses acquired, and built/ran teams of engineers from MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Google, FB, YC, MSR.

We received strong funding offers from a number of top tier VCs. We’re lucky to be working with a senior GP at our lead investor, along with a number of esteemed angels/funds, including well-known leaders in the design community.

We're looking for two more individuals:

- Founding generalist engineer. No particular tech specialization necessary (we use Typescript and React), but we’re ideally looking for a product-oriented engineer who has deep frontend experience.

- Founding design/product role - someone who has worked in a few different orgs (esp. the big product tech companies with strong design), knows their design tools, is interested in or has done product work, and has an extensive network of designers / can wear the evangelist hat.

In either role, you would be directly shaping everything from product direction to team to culture.

If interested, please drop us a line ASAP at designtoolstartup@googlegroups.com. Thanks, we're excited to hear from you!

items.content:
Rich Clicks is a fast-growing award-winning digital marketing company based in London specialized in the Italian and also European markets.


What are we looking for in an applicant?


We are looking for one creative, smart and autonomous Front End Designer (possibly Italian Speaker)


We’re looking for an innovator, a multi-talented person who can help us in one of the essential areas of our business. We're looking for a Junior / Middle level of experience so 1/2 years ideally.


So what does the role actually involve?



  • Front End design on various platform: Wordpress, Shopify, Unbounce, etc.



  • Create creative visual concepts and ideas forBanners, Landing Pages, Email Marketing, etc.

  • Landing Page Design, using various platforms such as Sharpspring, Unbounce, Leadpages or even custom HTML.

  • Learn how to design on our Marketing Automation Platform for Landing pages, Newsletters, mini-websites.

  • Managing projects and ongoing activities with precision and reliability.

  • Work in close relationship with the Digital Marketing Consultants and our Senior Web Developer.


Required Education, Skills and Qualifications



  • Good knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript

  • Attention to details, even the smallest ones (this is very important)

  • Working following a methodology.

  • Multi-project ability, time-management, and forward planning.

  • Capability to take accountability of the tasks and propose solutions design-wise.

  • Curiosity, willing to learn and being updated.


Something More About Us:



  • We're a team of 16 people, mostly Italians, close and friendly but also very well organized.

  • We follow an AGILE/SCRUM Methodology to plan our weeks in advance.

  • We'll give you one more day off for every year you work with us.

  • We give the possibility to work from home when necessary

  • We have free coffee/tea at the office, a truly authentic Italian espresso coffee :)

  • We offer a Birthday day off because we think that you should celebrate instead of working.



  • We often organize internal and external training

  • We like to be transparent and you'll work in an open office with the team and the founders.

  • We organize Fun Fridays!

  • We are RichClicks and we are innovators!


As a part of the hiring process, your knowledge will be tested during the interviews and we require a portfolio.


Salary


The Salary range is not shown because we would keep the position open to who has more seniority, we'd like to evaluate your experience and then make a proposal that could reward your experience.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
UX/UI Designer

Company: ELAV (Eat Like A VIP)
Location:
Remote location: Partially remote
Salary: 18.000 - 21.600 €
Level: Intermediate
Language: English Language: Portuguese
UX / UI Designer
Skills:
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • Agile Methodologies
  • CSS
  • Customer Support
  • Graphic Design
  • HTML
  • JavaScript
  • Prototyping
  • Team Management
  • User Flows
  • User Interface Design
  • User-centered Design
  • UX Design

    • Intro

    As a founding team member, you'll have the ability to lay the foundations of what the company will become. We are looking for generalists as your responsibilities will lie beyond the scope of your specified responsibilities.

    UX/UI designer role description and responsibilities:
    We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX Designer who will be responsible for the user experience and user interface design of our various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.

    You'll be rapidly designing and prototyping new features and ideas. You will be expected to contribute to all aspects of design and execution, including pitching your ideas, designing the feature (visual design, interaction design, and prototyping), and partnering with engineering to implement your vision. You will be expected to be able to communicate your ideas to team members.



    Responsibilities

    • Conceive new feature ideas and pitch them to the team
    • Design and prototype simple and intuitive experiences
    • A/B test new UI and UX ideas
    • Contribute to all stages of the design process from user research to wireframes and shipping the product
    • Identify the needs of both customers and restaurants and create features to satisfy those needs
    • Track metrics to ensure the optimal user experience
    • Help define the short and long-term roadmap for the products
    • Regularly give and receive feedback on design iterations
    • Work with other team members to oversee new user experiences from concept to launch
    • Communicate design goals and specifications to the engineers responsible for building them
    • Build sitemaps, wireframes, and prototypes to outline structure

    Who you are:

    • +3 years of experience with UI design
    • Ability to prototype interactive mobile experiences
    • Strong visual design skills and passion for interaction design
    • Excellent communication and presentation skills. You’ll be expected to clearly communicate design strategy to the team, including the engineers
    • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
    • Technical background or familiarity with software engineering
    • Capable of acting as a Product Manager when needed
    • Proficiency in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, or other design tools
    • Ability to think at a high level about product strategy
    • Self-motivated attitude with the ability to work in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous work environment
    • Loves dining with friends and family!

    Main requirements

    • Comfortable with HTML, CSS, and Javascript
    • Highly proficient with Wireframing, Mockups, User flows, Adobe CS, and Prototyping




    Nice to have

    • +1 year experience as a graphic designer and/or front-end engineer
    • Experience as a waiter or in the restaurant industry
    • Photography portfolio, or have completed a course in photography
    • Sales experience

     


     

     





    Perks

    • Equity in the business
    • Target monthly completed meals: For every month that we reach our goal of meals completed by our users, all team members will receive a bonus. This is to incentivize all team members to participate in evangelizing the ELAV story.
      • €100 credit on the app, plus €50 to share with friends and family!
    • Referral bonus: refer a great candidate and earn a €500 bonus once the new team member has been with the company for 4 months.
      • Earn €1000 for referring candidate from underrepresented groups
    • Visiting grant: if you are not located in the Lisbon district, we will pay for transportation fees for any mandatory in-person meetings and events.

items.title: UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
UX Designer at Taproot Foundation

Remote

Taproot Plus, Taproot Foundations online marketplace for pro bono, directly delivers on our mission by connecting nonprofit professionals with passionate, skilled volunteers who share their expertise pro bono via online, virtual programming. Through Taproot Plus, business professionals deliver expertise and support in areas like marketing, strategy, HR, and IT strategy so that organizations are even more equipped to positively affect society. This role sits on the Program Operations team, which supports the organizations online programs as well as the organizations technology infrastructure.

We are looking for a talented designer with a passion for combining thoughtful interaction design and beautiful visual design to deliver engaging product experiences to our users. You will be responsible for concept ideation and design, prototyping, and presenting ideas to the team. You will work collaboratively with the Taproot Plus team of product managers, developers content managers and customer support to explore and design solutions, hit milestones and reach goals.

This is a remote position and can be located anywhere in the United States. Taproot Foundation has offices in New York City, Chicago, San Francisco and Los Angeles. The UX Designer reports to the Vice President of Program Operations.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead design efforts across the entire product lifecycle from discovery to design optimization to refinement
  • Generate ideas and prototype concepts that are anchored in research insights, subject knowledge, technology requirements, and team and product goals
  • Execute hands-on design work across the customer experience, including web, email and beyond
  • Develop and validate design solutions to complex user problems
  • Collaborate closely with product managers, developers and customer support teams on research activities, strategy sessions, ideation, design, and testing of new concepts
  • Partner and communicate effectively with key stakeholders across the organization.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

  • 3+ years professional experience designing web and mobile applications
  • Experience conducting user research and analysis
  • Proficiency with a variety of design tools including Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, InVision or equivalent
  • Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Experience working and collaborating with diverse teams in a dynamic, rapid growth environment
  • Highly motivated and self-directed
  • Ability to assess and prioritize against constraints
  • A portfolio of UX/UI design that displays your strategy and process
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Visual Designer at Plato Design

Remote | Freelance | International

Anywhere

Who are we?

Plato is a new type of design agency. We empower people to do what they love from anywhere in the world. Our vision is to blend the best of human creativity with the power of Machine Learning to reimagine collaboration with each other, and partnership with our clients.

We believe that if you hire talented folks, lead with trust, and give people the tools they need to succeed, then creativity will come. Our team is completely distributed, but we’re building new modes of operation together.

Our team leverages technology to collaborate because we want to, dives into deep work when we need to, and (every so often) connects in real life because we like to. With us, you get the opportunity to be curious and collaborate with passionate peers, without sacrificing autonomy or career ownership.

Plato is proud to be backed by Y Combinator and some of Silicon Valley’s best investors. Join us on our untraditional, inspiring journey.

The Role:

Plato is looking for a wide range of experienced design thinkers to help us deliver interesting, useful design projects to our customers. As a freelance designer, you can be located anywhere and take on as many or as few projects as you’d like.

As a Visual Designer in the Plato Creative Network, you’ll be responsible for communicating complex ideas through multimedia. Most projects will require designing information architecture, layouts, illustration, and make all other aesthetic decisions related to a project. Projects types include Slide Decks, One Pagers, Email Templates and Facebook Ads. You’ll be compensated based on the complexity of the project.

Ideal Visual Designer candidates have a high quality bar, with a portfolio that displays a range of project types, aesthetics and use cases. You should have a track record of success delivering high quality work on schedule, and should enjoy collaborating as a part of a fast moving team. You must also have a “business fluent” level proficiency in written English.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Manager, Brand Retention and Integration at J2 Global

Remote

Client Support Remote

Description

Position at j2 Cloud Services

We are seeking a full-time brand manager and retention specialist who is customer-focused, motivated to learn, and will act as a liaison between the customer support and marketing departments to develop next-level retention policies and procedures for improving customer satisfaction and churn.

The ideal candidate will have prior experience in a technical support help desk and be able to assist with help desk configurations for onboarding and managing new and upcoming brands. The ideal candidate will be self-motivating and have leadership experience to assist in building and scaling support teams around new brands.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide next-level technical support via tickets, phone, and live chat
  • Monitor, report and review customer service agents kpi’s
  • Engage and create strategies for customer retention
  • Provide reporting to management on support volume
  • Create and manage help desk articles, and create and manage help desk rules and features for brand automation
  • Assist in future helpdesk integrations for upcoming brand inclusions.

REQUIRED PERSONAL SKILLS:

  • Excellent interpersonal/communication skills, both written and verbal
  • An ability to extend understanding and patience in stressful situations
  • Consistency with regards to organization, time management, attention to detail, and commitment
  • The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • The ability to adapt to change and properly resolve conflict
  • Desire to expand existing deductive reasoning and problem-solving skills
  • The ability to prioritize tasks accurately, making decisions within established guidelines and policies
  • The ability to learn new skills in a timely manner without sacrificing existing responsibilities

EXPERIENCE:

  • Technical troubleshooting and problem-solving in a work environment
  • Customer service experience in a technical support position
  • Intermediate to advanced experience with Windows, MacOS or Linux systems/software
  • Knowledge and/or use of commonly used Internet Protocols
  • Multiple social media platforms and associated applications
  • Scheduling and agent management
  • Customer retention
  • Experience with the following is strongly preferred:
    • Online Media & Streaming Services
    • Popular Filesharing Services
    • VPN
    • SmartDNS
    • Popular Social Media Platforms
    • Network troubleshooting
Apply for job

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


We're a VC-backed digital insurer of the future. We use machine learning, automation, our own technology stack and comprehensive data integrations to be quicker, cheaper and fairer to customers, and are looking for a graphic designer to communicate a fresh approach - to both our customers and potential employees.


We're a team of 35 with experience at the likes of Intercom, Monzo, Transferwise, Depop, backed by investors who have backed Spotify, Monzo, Adyen and others. Over the next 2 years we will grow the team to 150, as we expand our revenue product offering and geography - pushing further in to the multi-trillion $ insurance market.


THE ROLE


As a Graphic Designer, you will be working with our senior management team, marketing and HR to present an online image of Marshmallow that enthuses customers and prospective employees about Marshmallow's mission.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Conceptualising & designing Marshmallow's brand image for both customers and prospective empolyees

  • Define Marshmallow's presence on the web

  • Inspire potential customers & promote our brand image across marketing content & advertising across digital & print

  • Continue to build the relationship with our customers by leading on customer facing communications & assets

  • Work closely with customer operations, design & product teams

  • Manage multiple briefs and organise your time effectively and independently

  • Develop and present ideas for stakeholders and the wider team to see

  • Define brand guidelines across all mediums


REQUIREMENTS



  • 1+ commercial experience

  • Strong visual aesthetic with high level of finished product demonstrating understanding of quality communication design

  • Strong communication skills both in your work and your character

  • Multidiscipline approach - able to work across multiple medium

  • Passion for the details, output and application of your work

  • Someone with strong organisational skills, taking the initiative

  • Confident ability using a range of creative tooling including: Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign


Bonus skills



  • Understanding of CSS3, HTML5 & Javascript (jQuery or similar)

  • Animation using After Effects, CSS animations or similar

  • Video editing experience


WHO WILL YOU BE WORKING WITH


Closely with our lead product designer, and the designer who has been managing brand thus far......Jason: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jsnford/


CULTURE


https://www.notion.so/getmarshmallow/Company-Values-e798b5c1fce54e8789274cf83c978831


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salary 

  • Stock options 

  • Working from home 

  • Monthly Socials 

  • 32 day holiday allowance (inc bank holidays) 

  • Pension 

  • Cycle to work scheme 

  • Unlimited books 

  • Equipment you need to get the job done 

  • Weekly knowledge sharing presentations 

  • Friday all-hands with snacks 

  • Learning and training supported 

  • Fruit, snacks and soft drinks in the office 

  • Health insurance 


INTERVIEW PROCESS


1) 30-45 minute phone call


2) Design task where we ask you to design something specific and ask for your 'process' (task should take 2-4 hours)


3) On-site

items.content:
komoot

Brand Manager

verified
Anywhere within UTC-1 to UTC+3
**Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times—and, with more than 8 million users and 50,000 five-star reviews - komoot is on its way to becoming one of the most popular cycling and hiking apps. Now we are looking for a Brand Manager to establish komoot as a global brand for more than 300 million people searching for great outdoor experiences.** **Why you will love it** * You’ll drive the komoot brand strategy and inspire cyclists, hikers and outdoor enthusiasts all over the world. * You’ll play a key role in our marketing team, enjoying full responsibility and total ownership of your tasks from day one. * You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love. * You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers. * We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone between UTC-1 and UTC+3. * You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides. Our last team gathering was in Austrian Alps. # Responsibilities **What you will do:** * Develop and shape our brand strategy for different target groups and regions to establish komoot as a global cycling and outdoor brand. * Translate our vision and brand into inspiring stories that’ll be shared with millions of cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts. * Plan, build and execute campaigns across all our communication channels, from our social media and blog to our newsletter that’s read by millions. * Team up with copywriters, designers, photographers and videographers to shape our storytelling, refine our visual language, and to produce stunning images and videos. # Requirements **What will make you successful in the role:** * You have 5+ years of experience in brand management as well as in planning and executing impactful digital campaigns. * You possess proven knowledge and interest in the cycling and outdoor market and their respective customer segments. * You have a deep understanding of branding, with demonstrable hands-on experience in brand storytelling and crafting channel and target group specific messages. * You possess strong communication skills. You are confident and articulate, an empathic listener and persuasive storyteller. You convey impactful messages with ease. * You have a keen eye for visual language, good copy and videos that inspire people. * You speak English at a native level, are highly self-driven and possess a hands-on attitude to getting things done. #Location - Anywhere within UTC-1 to UTC+3

items.title: Academic Technology Instructional Designer
items.content:
Academic Technology Instructional Designer at Antioch University

Remote

This position is responsible for Antioch University instructional design functions related to the development and revision of AU curricular products in face-to-face, hybrid, and 100% online learning environments with an emphasis on active and experiential learning in all delivery modalities. This role will serve as primary instructional designer for Antioch University Online courses, as well as working directly with faculty and academic unit directors in multiple programs fostering best practices in instructional strategies.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provide pedagogical and instructional design consultation and support to faculty and academic program personnel to plan and improve instructional delivery with technology, including analysis of faculty and program needs, instructional materials design and production, and course
  • Employ project management skills to ensure timely support to a variety of faculty and academic units across the university.
  • Assist faculty in choosing and implementing instructional technologies consistent with university resources and suited to the faculty member’s abilities and needs.
  • Collaborate with university service departments on the administration of academic technologies such as learning management systems and video conferencing tools.
  • Contribute instructional design expertise to the development and maintenance of faculty development resources such as, multimedia tutorials, reference material, design standards, content resources, templates, and informational announcements for instructional development and program consistency.
  • Assist faculty with identifying sources of instructional media such as graphics, interactive activities, scenarios, video and other electronic materials to enrich course content.
  • Help in testing agreed-upon emerging teaching and learning technologies. Research and identify emerging educational and instructional technologies that can bring innovative and creative approaches to the curriculum.
  • Maintain currency in new and innovative approaches in teaching and
  • Other duties as assigned. Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • Master’s degree in instructional technology, educational technology or related field required.
  • Higher education experience preferred.
  • Project management experience preferred.

Knowledge and Skills

  • Proficiency with appropriate software, including online course management software, web browsers, web authoring tools, standard office productivity tools required. Familiarity with mobile devices instruction, responsive interface design, video and image manipulation, presentation software, HTM/XML, and media production skills desired.
  • Ability to apply theories of instructional design and adult learning to the development of online or hybrid learning experiences required.
  • Ability to troubleshoot technical issues via phone, email, videoconferencing and in person to find solutions to challenges faced by faculty.
  • Knowledge of copyright, fair use, and accessibility regulations related to online learning.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Strong critical and analytical thinking skills.

Attributes and Abilities

  • Exercise professional judgment regarding highly confidential department, budget, and student matters.
  • Work independently, organize, handle detail, follow-through on tasks and problem solve with minimal supervision, in a complex administrative and academic environment.
  • Work effectively, collaboratively, and cooperatively with a diverse body of faculty, staff, and administrators. Ability to interact with a wide range of users and technicians.
  • Have a clear understanding and commitment to diversity, equity and cultural competence.
  • Possess a keen understanding of, and sensitivity to, the human factors and accessibility requirements involved in introducing educational technology.
  • Adapt to organizational and individual circumstances.
  • Differentiate level of assistance according faculty ability and need.

Hours of Employment

  • This is a full-time position. The work schedule will be established in consultation with Director of Academic Technology. The typical work week is Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week.

Work Location

  • This may be a remote or campus-based position, though proximity to one of our campuses in Seattle, WA; Los Angeles, CA; Santa Barbara, CA; or Keene, NH, is preferred. Specific location will be established with the supervisor prior to appointment.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Periods of stress due to level, variety, nature, and volume of work. High volume of computer work required. Occasional travel may be required.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=23, embedded=0, frontend=11}
items.content:
Web Designer at Yoko Co.

Remote | International

Location: Remote/Telecommute. International applicants welcome.

Alright, here’s the deal. We’re looking to hire someone to primarily do two things: (1) Design totally badass stuff and (2) help to build it.

Often, the aforementioned badass stuff will be in the form of WordPress-based websites. So, it’s critical that you’re familiar with WordPress and feel pretty comfortable bending it to your will. Experience using popular page builders, like Beaver Builder, Visual Composer and Divi, is a big plus. Beaver Builder especially.

You don’t need to be a hardcore developer to do this job (we’ve got some of those on staff, we intravenously pump them full of caffeine and try to avoid making direct eye contact). However, for you, a working knowledge of HTML and CSS will be fairly important.

Right about now feels like a good time to make a list.

In this job, you will:

  • Design websites, layouts, app interfaces and more. They will look terrific.
  • Help to build/code/assemble these things.
  • Use WordPress, a lot.
  • Collaborate closely with your team members, including other designers, developers and project managers.

And you’ll need:

  • Killer design skills.
  • A fundamental understanding of UX/UI principles
  • Strong ability with Adobe software, particularly Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign. Also, we use Figma a lot.
  • Functional knowledge of HTML and CSS.
  • Experience with WordPress page builders, particularly Beaver Builder.
  • An enchanted fedora that allows the wearer to see into the future.

We know what you’re thinking. “Hey, this sounds exactly like the type of stuff I love to do! In fact, I love it so much, I’d do it for free!” Well, guess what: If you work here, you won’t have to.

That’s right, we pay our employees.

Your mind = blown.

In exchange for your services, you’ll be rewarded with a flexible work schedule, competitive pay, unlimited leave, as well as participation in our annual shutdown (often two weeks off, sometimes more, at the end of the year). Plus, we celebrate most federal holidays by not working.

To get started, send an email to careers@yokoco.com. Use the subject line “Where do I sign?” If you don’t use that subject line, you won’t get the job. Be sure to include a link to your portfolio.

Apply for job

items.content:
We are an international team of lawyers and technologists, working to reinvent the startup law experience from the ground up. Clara graduated from Techstars Dubai’s class of 2019 and closed a USD 2,000,000 seed round before expanding into London. We move fast (but thoughtfully), and are looking for a talented and impact-oriented UX/UI Designer to join us.


As part of a startup, your responsibilities will vary, but on a day to day basis, you will:



  • Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes for a wide range of devices and interfaces that lead to intuitive user experiences and effectively communicate interaction and design ideas

  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience

  • Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders

  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features.

  • Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.

  • Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering

  • Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards


We are looking for someone who: 



  • shares our philosophy; 

  • is capable and excited about the role; 

  • strives for personal and professional excellence; 

  • and wants to make a meaningful difference through their work. 


The opportunity is for you if you have:



  • Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role with a portfolio of design projects

  • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, OmniGraffle, or other visual design and wire-framing tools as well as standard UX software such as Figma, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

  • Ability to work effectively in a remote team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.

  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

  • BS/MS in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related

  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum/Kanban development process

  • A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.

  • Up-to-date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies


Minimum Requirements:



  • At least 3 years of UI/UX experience in a well known software environment

  • BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field

  • Must be fluent (written/spoken) in English.

  • Solid oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills.

  • Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for data driven software functionality

items.content:
Company OverviewFounded in 2007, Theorem (formerly Citrusbyte) is a technology consulting company with a focus on how we do the work as a means to achieve great results.Our customers, F1000's and startups alike, come to us because they need to change how something is done in order to succeed and they're looking for a solution that isn't just about technology - but also people, process and leadership. We consult, form a diverse team of experts, and deliver strategy and execution all under one roof.Our services range from new product development, pure R&D, legacy modernization, pricing strategy development, revenue generation, process optimization, to organizational transformation and cultural design.Working at TheoremAt Theorem, we believe that creating an environment where great people can flourish is the best strategy for our business and the best way to solve our client's problems and deliver the greatest value.Our focus on culture is supported by our shared vision to build a company where we want to work for the long-term. We avoid egos and embrace distributed leadership. We grow from constantly being challenged and seek to understand when presented with ideas we don't understand. We respect each other, default to trust and treat each other like adults and we also hold each other accountable for commitments. There is a lot about our culture that makes us great and we're continually looking to improve it. Read what we've published about our culture.Job SummaryAs a UX Researcher you will work with small cross functional teams to create and execute on research plans. You will be responsible for surfacing research insights that will inspire product strategy. This new addition to our team is a curious person, has a strong sense of humility and deeply cares about solving the right problem.Theorem works with Fortune 500 clients which requires a researcher who is a natural consultant that is comfortable presenting to and engaging with clients that range from stakeholders to C-Suite executives. Our practice will benefit from the candidate's proactive and thoughtful recommendations integrating research into Theorem's fast-paced product development culture.This is a remote friendly role. Candidates within North America will be given priority for the sake of travel and team time zone alignment.Responsibilities And Duties Lead research for discovery and iterative product development initiatives Partner with Product Managers and Designers recommending research practices and providing UX feedback on solutions Plan, conduct, synthesize and communicate research findings to the internal team and our clients Develop an understanding of our client's users, their competition and the marketplace Produce clear and impactful artifacts that surface the most meaningful stories from the research findings Coordinate recruiting, scheduling and communication with research participants Manage relationships with third-party research vendors when needed Qualifications And Skills 7+ years of product design research experience Seasoned practitioner in both qualitative and quantitative research, with an appreciation for applying lean methodologies to process Experience with both generative and evaluative research initiatives Demonstrates expertise with preparation for and execution of interviewing, concept testing, usability testing, ethnographic research, diary studies, heuristic evaluations, surveys, personas, journey maps, remote testing and benchmarks
Product pricing research experience is an added plus Willingness to travel Benefits And Perks 100% remote Once a year the entire Theorem team gets together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play. This year's retreat was in Tuscany, Italy! We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan Theorem expects employees to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We encourage success based on our individual merits and abilities, and all decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee development decisions such as training, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, nationality, national origin, citizenship status, employment status, ethnicity, ethnic origin, color, creed, religion, belief, age, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual preference, lifestyle, social class, military status, disability, physical features, or any other protected status. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination. Theorem is an equal opportunity employer.No statements by Theorem are intended to create an offer of employment unless made in a writing signed by an officer of the company and no offer shall become effective unless countersigned by the prospective employee.mAllgGEGUD

items.title: Marketing Artist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=24, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketing Artist at Highrise

Remote | International

REMOTE

MARKETING

ART

About Highrise

Highrise is a mobile game and community where people make avatars, design art and environments and meet new friends. We are building on the spirit of applications like Animal Crossing, The Sims, Habbo Hotel and Second Life.

Over 3 million people create avatars, chat and make friends in Highrise. We are a fully remote team of 20 backed by YCombinator, Bessemer, Maveron and other leading investors.

About the Role

We are looking for a marketing artist. You will be creating videos and images to market on various advertising channels, including Facebook, Snapchat and others. This is comes with a wide variety of responsibilities: creating animated and static creative, storyboarding ad concepts, and organizing creative content and tracking performance. You’ll be working closely with our CEO, UA Manager, and our in-house art team. This job is fully remote.

This role will give you the opportunity to…

  • Design creative for major marketing platforms like Facebook, Snap, Tik Tok, and more
  • Come up with unique ideas and manifest them
  • Experiment with a wide variety of styles, formats and messages
  • Work closely with the marketing and art teams to receive direct feedback on what is and isn’t working
  • Iterate quickly and learn FAST

To be successful in this role, we’d expect you to…

  • Have 2+ years of animation experience
  • Have some art experience
  • Enjoy crafting marketing messages and storyboards
  • Spend time to understand our audience
  • Communicate effectively with both artists and marketing managers
  • Know how to accept and work with feedback
  • Iterate and learn very quickly

Within 3 months you’ll…

  • Evaluate our current creative pipeline
  • Design multiple animated creatives per week
  • Develop a feel for competitor ads
  • Develop a feel for what the Highrise audience finds compelling
  • Work closely with in-house artists to organize and use our 10,000+ art assets
  • Work closely with our marketing manager to iterate on ads based on performance

Within 6 months you’ll…

  • Develop a high performing creative pipeline
  • Continue to iterate on ads and come up with new creative concepts
  • Track ROI and other ad metrics to deeply understand performance
Apply for job

items.title: UX Researcher (Remote OK)
items.content:
Company OverviewFounded in 2007, Theorem (formerly Citrusbyte) is a technology consulting company with a focus on how we do the work as a means to achieve great results.Our customers, F1000's and startups alike, come to us because they need to change how something is done in order to succeed and they're looking for a solution that isn't just about technology - but also people, process and leadership. We consult, form a diverse team of experts, and deliver strategy and execution all under one roof.Our services range from new product development, pure R&D, legacy modernization, pricing strategy development, revenue generation, process optimization, to organizational transformation and cultural design.Working at TheoremAt Theorem, we believe that creating an environment where great people can flourish is the best strategy for our business and the best way to solve our client's problems and deliver the greatest value.Our focus on culture is supported by our shared vision to build a company where we want to work for the long-term. We avoid egos and embrace distributed leadership. We grow from constantly being challenged and seek to understand when presented with ideas we don't understand. We respect each other, default to trust and treat each other like adults and we also hold each other accountable for commitments. There is a lot about our culture that makes us great and we're continually looking to improve it. Read what we've published about our culture.Job SummaryAs a UX Researcher you will work with small cross functional teams to create and execute on research plans. You will be responsible for surfacing research insights that will inspire product strategy. This new addition to our team is a curious person, has a strong sense of humility and deeply cares about solving the right problem.Theorem works with Fortune 500 clients which requires a researcher who is a natural consultant that is comfortable presenting to and engaging with clients that range from stakeholders to C-Suite executives. Our practice will benefit from the candidate's proactive and thoughtful recommendations integrating research into Theorem's fast-paced product development culture.This is a remote friendly role. Candidates within North America will be given priority for the sake of travel and team time zone alignment.Responsibilities And Duties Lead research for discovery and iterative product development initiatives Partner with Product Managers and Designers recommending research practices and providing UX feedback on solutions Plan, conduct, synthesize and communicate research findings to the internal team and our clients Develop an understanding of our client's users, their competition and the marketplace Produce clear and impactful artifacts that surface the most meaningful stories from the research findings Coordinate recruiting, scheduling and communication with research participants Manage relationships with third-party research vendors when needed Qualifications And Skills 7+ years of product design research experience Seasoned practitioner in both qualitative and quantitative research, with an appreciation for applying lean methodologies to process Experience with both generative and evaluative research initiatives Demonstrates expertise with preparation for and execution of interviewing, concept testing, usability testing, ethnographic research, diary studies, heuristic evaluations, surveys, personas, journey maps, remote testing and benchmarks
Product pricing research experience is an added plus Willingness to travel Benefits And Perks 100% remote Once a year the entire Theorem team gets together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play. This year's retreat was in Tuscany, Italy! We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan Theorem expects employees to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We encourage success based on our individual merits and abilities, and all decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee development decisions such as training, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, nationality, national origin, citizenship status, employment status, ethnicity, ethnic origin, color, creed, religion, belief, age, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual preference, lifestyle, social class, military status, disability, physical features, or any other protected status. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination. Theorem is an equal opportunity employer.No statements by Theorem are intended to create an offer of employment unless made in a writing signed by an officer of the company and no offer shall become effective unless countersigned by the prospective employee.eDBCFJ2Fde

items.title: Marketing Visual Designer (Gaming)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=10, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=45, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketing Visual Designer (Gaming)

Company: Social Point
Location:
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
UX / UI Designer
Skills:
  • 3D animation and modeling
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • Photoshop
  • Unity3D
  • Visual Design

    • Intro

     
    We are a world reference social game developer and publisher for Mobile and Facebook. Ever heard of Dragon City, Monster Legends, World Chef or Dragon Land? That’s us! Our Social Point egg hatched in 2008 and we’ve only been growing since then!
    A few numbers: We have over 50 million fans worldwide and there’s just about 350 of us to create super cool games for them all from 1 unique office in sunny Barcelona. Over the years, we did so well that Take Two Interactive asked us join their gaming family in February 2017.

    Our dreams and our purpose: To work together to make games that connect players through social gaming and to provide the most enjoyable, immersive playing experience.

    We offer a fun, lively and dynamic workplace, headquartered in Barcelona, where creativity, agility and innovation are encouraged, prized and rewarded. Working with us will see you develop your skills, play drive your career and delight millions of people around the world.

    What will you do in Social Point?

    • Collaborate creatively and artistically with the marketing department, autonomously managing your delivery times
    • You will be a key player in the creative process, contributing with ideas in brainstorming sessions, defining delivery dates with the rest of the team and providing all the graphic elements needed for marketing campaigns
    • Take part in the creative processes to create stunning marketing campaigns (benchmark, brainstorming, storyboard and animatic.)
    • Create assets for UA campaigns and fan sites, collaborating with the Marketing Video Artist
    • Manage expectations and ensuring timely delivery of all animated assets for all marketing campaigns
    • Create and aligning your own road maps with the Marketing team's
    • Collaborate with the outsourcing department to provide higher volumes of creation when needed
    • Keep up to date with the new trends and best practices in User Acquisition 

    Main requirements

    •  At least 2 years of experience in the video game or the advertising industry
    • Strong and multidisciplinary art skillset
    • Expert working with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop)
    • Passionate about narrative and visual communication
    • Proactive, self-driven yet a good team player with a positive attitude!
    • A problem solver with a great eye for detail
    • Fluent in English 

    Nice to have

    •  Previous experience in marketing for mobile games
    • Knowledge of best practices in digital and traditional advertising
    • Interest in data and analytics
    • Experience in Unity and 3D software (3D Max, Maya or C4D) is a plus 

    Perks

    •  You’ll get top of the range devices to work with, along with a Spotify Premium account
    • “Mens sana in corpore sano” is the Latin for “a healthy mind in a healthy body”. Our Social Pointers get a healthy Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus + access to our private gym and fantastic physiotherapist
    • “An apple a day keeps the doctor away” so we get fresh fruit at the office but also a private medical insurance, just in case
    • Monthly events to get you to know your colleagues, drop by our hairdresser’s to get ready (Forget the wallet)
    • People development is key for us: coupling an amazing training budget just for you and our internal mobility programs, you get real growth opportunities!
    • Cool offices in the tech neighborhood. Gym and gaming room on site!
    • New to Barcelona? we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons and help with all your boring paperwork!

items.content:
Paid Research Study for IOT developers!

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Industry: AI Research, Market Research, Surveying
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: User Research International | No office location

Technologies

iot

Job description

User Research International is a research company based out of Redmond, Washington. Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience. We are currently conducting a research study called Visual Studio Study. We are looking for currently employed Full-Time Developers who use GIT. This study is a one-time Remote Study via an online meeting. We’re offering $150 for participation in this study. Session lengths are 60 minutes. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products or software. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. If you complete the survey, and you are actually a fit to the study's requirements, URI will follow up with you. I have summarized the study details below. In order to be considered, you must take the survey below. Thank you!

Study: Visual Studio Study

Gratuity: $150

Session Length: 60 minutes  

Location: Remote via online connection 

Dates: October. Available dates are located within the survey

Survey: Visual Studio Study Survey Link

Apply now

About User Research International

We use your experience to improve upon the products you use. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your experience. 

Benefits

  • Paid research studies
  • Improving tech
  • Getting your feedback and experience
  • Meeting researchers working directly on the products you use

items.title: Mid-level Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Motorway is reinventing how cars are bought and sold online. Our mission is to bring the car industry into the future through ground-breaking products and best in class design.


In 2017 we launched the first comparison website for selling your car. With a few taps, customers can compare live offers for their car, select the best deal and sell within 24 hours. Since then we have grown significantly and recently launched Motorway Pro, a platform for dealers to search and buy cars online.


We are now looking for a talented Visual Designer to help create the next phase of Motorway’s journey.


About the role


As part of a four-person design team, you’ll be responsible for creating design work across the business, including:



  • Advertising creatives for offline and out-of-home campaigns

  • Emails, banners, videos and widgets to support our online marketing, content, social media and CRM campaigns

  • Branded merchandise and clothing

  • Illustrations and icon design

  • UI design and page layouts for our digital products and websites

  • Signage, branding and interior design for our offices in Brighton and London

  • Lots of other top secret features and projects we’re working on but can’t talk about publicly


You’ll create design work for our consumer brand (motorway.co.uk) and our Pro brand used by car dealers (pro.motorway.co.uk).


What we’re looking for



  • Some commercial experience in a design role or internship, demonstrated by a strong portfolio. 

  • An ability to solve real problems through design, demonstrated by examples of projects or features that have had a measurable impact on the business or organisation

  • Strong aesthetic ability and visual taste, resulting in work that is powerful and beautiful to behold. 

  • Typography, colour, illustration, photography, icons, branding… you are all over this

  • An exceptional eye for detail and a precise, accurate approach to creating design work

  • Experience with design tools such as Adobe CC and Sketch, and collaboration tools like Dropbox and Slack, plus strong Mac skills

  • Comfortable collaborating with different areas of the business, such as commercial, marketing or development teams

  • A personal interest and passion for visual creativity, be it art, product design, graphic design or photography

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills

  • A friendly, positive personality with a willingness to work hard and as part of a team

  • Ambition to develop and be the best at what you do


What we offer



  • A competitive salary and equity package

  • The chance to join a rapidly growing company that cares first and foremost about its people

  • The chance to work with an experienced entrepreneurial team, with a big vision

  • Fast career progression and the ability to develop your own skills and experience quickly

  • Flexible working, with the option to work from home or remotely some of the time

  • Enhanced Maternity/Paternity leave that increases with tenure

  • Regular social events

items.title: IT Asset Administrator
items.content:
IT Asset Administrator at Inovalon

Remote

Job Locations

US-Remote | US-AZ-Phoenix | US-MN-Minneapolis | US-TN-Antioch | US-MA-Boston | US-FL-Brandon

Requisition ID

2019-9727

Overview

The IT Asset Administrator will support the development and administration of the IT Asset Management (ITAM) program. The incumbent will oversee the receipt, tracking, disposition and retirement of all IT assets for the duration of their lifecycle; this includes but is not limited to maintaining records and databases containing licenses, warranties, and service agreement for Inovalon’s hardware and software technology assets.

Responsibilities

  • Administer ITAM tools and acts as a channel between ITAM tools, processes and technology with other departments to provide preemptive allocation and accurate updates to the asset repository;
  • Maintains all software licenses and subscriptions, ensures contractual compliance, preforms license reconciliation, true-up processes, and all internal and external software licensing audits;
  • Maintains proper implementation of ITAM policies, processes, and procedures for effective hardware and software lifecycle management;
  • Provides support in developing a comprehensive business plan for the management of assets, including brainstorming on the most effective, efficient, and economical procurement solution, in compliance with corporate policies and procedures and legislative requirements;
  • Maintains software and hardware assets in compliance with legislative requirements and accounting standards from acquisition to disposal (e.g. lifecycle management);
  • Works with stakeholders on virtual or physical audits of all IT hardware and software and enforces processes and procedures to ensure accuracy;
  • Maintain compliance with Inovalon’s policies, procedures and mission statement;
  • Adhere to all confidentiality and HIPAA requirements as outlined within Inovalon’s Operating Policies and Procedures in all ways and at all times with respect to any aspect of the data handled or services rendered in the undertaking of the position;
  • Fulfill those responsibilities and/or duties that may be reasonably provided by Inovalon to achieve operational and financial success of the Company;
  • Perform additional duties and related responsibilities as required; and
  • All candidates to comply with all security policies/procedures.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in ITAM at an enterprise-wide level and/or in an ITAM capacity or equivalent;
  • Knowledgeable of IT Service Management (ITSM) and ITAM methodology, standards and frameworks (e.g. ITIL, ISO 19770-X, MOF, COBIT, etc.);
  • Understanding of software licensing;
  • Experience with IT technologies, including common hardware, networking, and software licensing;
  • Familiar with major service management platforms and ITAM Cloud/SaaS Tools; and
  • Strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, and service skills.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in the technology field;
Apply for job

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


About Monese


At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a current account can get one. By using bleeding-edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.


The first Monese products already serve well over a million people across the European Economic Area, and we have ambitious plans to add more products and features across many other regions.


About the role


We are looking for a Marketing Designer to join us on a permanent basis in our London office. You should have an eye for clean and artful design as well as interest for motion design. You will be able to learn from a team of more experienced designers.


Role specifics:



  • Facilitating and contributing to the creation, adoption and improvement of design ‘patterns’ and their consistent deployment across all company outputs

  • Shaping and defining the look and feel of the Monese experience both in browser, on mobile and in print

  • Producing final design solutions (e.g. ads, banners)

  • Pitching creative ideas that enhance projects

  • Working with the Marketing design team to clearly present design ideas to various groups to help build a unified design and artistic direction




REQUIREMENTS


What we are looking for:



  • Knowledge and experience of marketing and digital design

  • Typography and composition skills

  • Eye for detail and ability to put customer needs above complex design ideas

  • Hands-on experience with software like Sketch, Adobe Creative Cloud, After Effects

  • Understanding for various file formats to adapt numerous sizes and aspect ratios for social channels (e.g. Facebook, Instagram and Google UAC)

  • Passion for motion design (experience isn’t a must for this)

  • Ability to take charge of your time and meet deadlines

  • Fluent English skills


What we consider as a plus:



  • Video editing skills

  • Flair for 2D/3D illustration

  • 3D/C4D skills would be a bonus

  • Nice and approachable person with a sense of humour




BENEFITS


Benefits of working at Monese:



  • Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company

  • A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible

  • International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks

  • Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well

  • Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues

  • In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities

  • Flexible working schedule and possibility to work in home office from time to time

  • Additional week of vacation

  • Stock options and competitive salary


Sounds like something for you?


Then please send us your CV and cover letter. And be quick to apply, as we will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately.

All candidates must be eligible to work in UK.

items.content:
Gravity Forms

Senior Designer


Worldwide
Rocketgenius, Inc. is looking for full-time Senior Designer to help us take Gravity Forms to the next level. Relocation is not necessary, as we consider your geographic location a non-issue. Hours are flexible based on your time zone requirements. # Responsibilities Reporting to the Lead Developer your responsibility will be to design Gravity Forms products. The work entails: * Collaborating with the product development team to solve challenging UX and UI problems. * Turning complex requirements into simple interfaces that are intuitive and a pleasure to use. * Optimizing existing interfaces. * Holding accountability for a consistent experience across all our products. * Establishing design guidelines, best practices and standards. * Storyboarding, wireframing, prototyping, iteration, research and testing. * Keeping your teammates informed of your tasks and progress in weekly Zoom calls, Slack and project management tools. * Giving clear but kind feedback when reviewing work by others in the team. * Contributing to customer and internal documentation. # Requirements * Your passion is to create remarkable software that is a pleasure to use. * Proven background in user experience & interface design. * Strong skills in tools and technologies required for modern web design. * Excellent verbal, written and visual communication skills. **Bonus points** * You've already figured out solutions to the challenges of remote working. * Some experience with Gravity Forms. * Experience building another high-profile WordPress plugin or theme. #Location - Worldwide
